hypothesis_content.title: Crypto Majors 1-Hour Divergence Reversion
hypothesis_content.statement: A 1-hour bearish RSI divergence (price makes a higher high, RSI(14) makes a lower high) or bullish divergence (price makes a lower low, RSI makes a higher low) in a top 10 crypto asset, when occurring during NY trading hours (14:00-21:00 UTC), predicts a minimum 3% reversion in the direction of the divergence within 4 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: RSI divergence is a classic momentum weakening signal. The NY session filter adds liquidity and the presence of institutional desks more likely to act on these technical signals, providing the catalyst for the reversion.
entry_conditions: Clear 1-hour RSI divergence pattern (visual confirmation required)
Divergence forms with at least 3 consecutive lower/higher RSI peaks/troughs
Signal candle closes during NY hours (14:00-21:00 UTC)
Enter on the close of the candle confirming the divergence

exit_conditions.take_profit: 3% price move in the direction of the divergence signal
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves 2% against the signal direction, invalidating the divergence structure

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The win rate for divergence signals generated during NY hours is not statistically significantly higher (>10% absolute) than those generated in other sessions.
